Package tic_tac_toe

Class GameMaster

java.lang.Object
tic_tac_toe.GameMaster
public class GameMaster
extends java.lang.Object
Class implementing the game master of this tic-tac-toe program, the central class that provides access to all the methods necessary to run the system

The coordinate system used in this program is zero-based. Therefore, the upper left tile is referred to as (0,0), the tile below it is (1,0), and the tile beside it is (0,1). For simplicity, the move (x,y) is shorthand for placing a token on the tile (x,y).

The special coordinate (-1,-1) is used to indicate that, as a result of the game having reached its terminal state (that is, a win, loss, or draw), there are no valid tiles left on which a player's token can be placed.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameMaster

      public GameMaster()
      Creates a game master object

      Since the initialization of certain attributes (such as those related to the agent, the level of intelligence, and the first player to move) depend on choices made by the user, it is deferred and delegated to the setters, particularly to setAgent and setIsAgentFirst.

    • GameMaster

      public GameMaster​(java.lang.String initConfig)
      Creates a game master object given a string that represents its initial state (or configuration) of the board

      The string is of the form %%%|%%%|%%%, which is a flattened representation of the board state following row-major order. Each % stands for a tile while | is a mandatory delimiter to separate rows. Note that % can be any of the following characters:

      • * (EMPTY_TOKEN)
      • H (HUMAN_TOKEN)
      • C (COMPUTER_TOKEN)

      For example, a board with only a human token on the center is represented as ***|*H*|***.

      Parameters:
      initConfig - string representation of the initial state (or configuration)

    • setAgent

      public void setAgent​(int intelligence)
      Initializes the tic-tac-toe-playing agent depending on the specified level of intelligence

      This method also initializes the pertinent attribute related to the level of intelligence of the agent.

      Parameters:

    • setIsAgentFirst

      public void setIsAgentFirst​(boolean isAgentFirst)
      Updates the attribute related to which player is first to move
      Parameters:
      isAgentFirst - true if the tic-tac-toe-playing agent (computer) is first to move; false, otherwise

    • evalBestMove

      public Evaluation evalBestMove()
      Returns the best move given the current board state, alongside this agent's numerical evaluation of this move

      Note that the evaluation is material only if this agent employs the minimax algorithm (that is, only for levels 2 to 5). Otherwise, the evaluation is always set to 0 regardless of the actual optimality of the selected move.

      Returns:
      best move, alongside this agent's numerical evaluation of this move

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove​(int row, int col, char token)
      Updates the board state to reflect the most recent move given the row- and column-coordinates of the move, and the character code of the pertinent player
      Parameters:
      row - row-coordinate of the player's move
      col - column-coordinate of the player's move
      token - character code of the player making the move

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Returns true if either a winning or drawn configuration is detected (that is, this board is at its terminal state); false, otherwise

      Note that, for a configuration to be considered drawn, all 9 tiles must be occupied without the presence of any of three-in-a-lane. Although it is possible to infer that a position is drawn even before all tiles are occupied, these cases are deemed inconclusive in the interest of simplicity.

      Returns:
      true if either a winning or drawn configuration is detected; false, otherwise

    • isGameDraw

      public boolean isGameDraw()
      Returns true if a drawn configuration is detected; false, otherwise

      Note that, for a configuration to be considered drawn, all 9 tiles must be occupied without the presence of any of three-in-a-lane. Although it is possible to infer that a position is drawn even before all tiles are occupied, these cases are deemed inconclusive in the interest of simplicity.

      Returns:
      true if a drawn configuration is detected; false, otherwise

    • isAgentWin

      public boolean isAgentWin()
      Returns true if a winning configuration is registered by the tic-tac-toe- playing agent; false, otherwise

      A winning configuration is defined as in classical tic-tac-toe: a three-in-a-lane (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally).

      Returns:
      true if a winning configuration is registered by the tic-tac-toe playing agent; false, otherwise

    • isHumanWin

      public boolean isHumanWin()
      Returns true if a winning configuration is registered by the human player; false, otherwise

      A winning configuration is defined as in classical tic-tac-toe: a three-in-a-lane (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally).

      Returns:
      true if a winning configuration is registered by the human player; false, otherwise

    • recordWin

      public void recordWin​(char token)
      Update the match statistics related to the number of wins given the character code of the pertinent player
      Parameters:
      token - character code of the pertinent player

    • recordDraw

      public void recordDraw()
      Update the match statistics related to a draw

    • clearBoard

      public void clearBoard()
      Configures this board back to its initial state, that is, 9 unoccupied tiles arranged into 3 rows and 3 columns

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this game master

      The string representation contains the following details in order:

      • String representation of the board
      • String representation of the agent (which includes the move evaluation)
      • Match statistics (number of wins by the agent, number of wins by the human player, and number of draws — separated by a hyphen)
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      string representation of this game master
